trans-unit.source: Represents a variable-length stream of characters to be stored in or retrieved from the database.
<xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> has a different underlying data structure from its corresponding .NET Framework <xref href="System.String"></xref> data type.
<xref:System.String> always uses the default <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> from the current thread, but <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString> contains its own locale Id and compare flags.
The comparison result of two <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString> structures is independent of operating system and current thread locale.
When you use <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString> comparison operators, note that if the LCIDs of arguments are different, comparison functions throw an exception because they cannot be compared.
For example, the statement
is equivalent to
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> structure using the specified string.
The string to store.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> structure using the specified string and locale id values.
The string to store.
Specifies the geographical locale and language for the new <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> structure.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> structure using the specified locale id, compare options, and data.
Specifies the geographical locale and language for the new <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> structure.
Specifies the compare options for the new <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> structure.
The data array to store.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> structure using the specified string, locale id, and compare option values.
The string to store.
Specifies the geographical locale and language for the new <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> structure.
Specifies the compare options for the new <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> structure.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> class.
Specifies the geographical locale and language for the new <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> structure.
Specifies the compare options for the new <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> structure.
The data array to store.
`true` if Unicode encoded.
Otherwise, `false`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> class.
Specifies the geographical locale and language for the new <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> structure.
Specifies the compare options for the new <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> structure.
The data array to store.
The starting index within the array.
The number of characters from index to copy.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> class.
Specifies the geographical locale and language for the new <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> structure.
Specifies the compare options for the new <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> structure.
The data array to store.
The starting index within the array.
The number of characters from index to copy.
`true` if Unicode encoded.
Otherwise, `false`.
Concatenates two specified <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> values to create a new <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> structure.
`x` will appear first in the resulting <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString>, followed by `y`.
A <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref>.
A that is the concatenated value of x and y.
Specifies that sorts should be based on a characters numeric value instead of its alphabetical value.
<xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString.BinarySort> functions as a constant for the <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString> class.
Specifies that sorts should be based on a character's numeric value instead of its alphabetical value.
Creates a copy of this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> object.
A new <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> object in which all property values are the same as the original.
Gets the <xref href="System.Globalization.CompareInfo"></xref> object that defines how string comparisons should be performed for this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> structure.
A `CompareInfo` object that defines string comparison for this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> structure.
Gets the <xref href="System.Globalization.CompareOptions"></xref> enumeration equilvalent of the specified <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlCompareOptions"></xref> value.
A <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlCompareOptions"></xref> value that describes the comparison options for this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> structure.
A `CompareOptions` value that corresponds to the `SqlCompareOptions` for this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> structure.
Compares this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> instance to the supplied <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> and returns an indication of their relative values.
The <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> to be compared.
A signed number that indicates the relative values of the instance and the object.
Return value
Condition
Less than zero
This instance is less than the object.
Zero
This instance is the same as the object.
Greater than zero
This instance is greater than the object
-or-
The object is a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
Compares this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> object to the supplied <xref href="System.Object"></xref> and returns an indication of their relative values.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to be compared.
A signed number that indicates the relative values of the instance and the object.
Return Value
Condition
Less than zero
This instance is less than the object.
Zero
This instance is the same as the object.
Greater than zero
This instance is greater than the object
-or-
The object is a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic)
Concatenates the two specified <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> structures.
A <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> that contains the newly concatenated value representing the contents of the two <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> parameters.
Gets the <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo"></xref> structure that represents information about the culture of this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> object.

A <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo"></xref> structure that describes information about the culture of this SqlString structure including the names of the culture, the writing system, and the calendar used, and also access to culture-specific objects that provide methods for common operations, such as formatting dates and sorting strings.
Performs a logical comparison of the two <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> operands to determine whether they are equal.
A <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref>.
`true` if the two values are equal.
Otherwise, `false`.
If either instance is null, then the `SqlString` will be null.
Compares the supplied object parameter to the <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString.Value"></xref> property of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> object.
The object to be compared.
Equals will return `true` if the object is an instance of <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> and the two are equal; otherwise `false`.
Gets the hash code for this instance.
A 32-bit signed integer hash code.
Gets an array of bytes, that contains the contents of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> in ANSI format.
An byte array, that contains the contents of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> in ANSI format.
Gets an array of bytes, that contains the contents of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> in Unicode format.
An byte array, that contains the contents of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> in Unicode format.
Returns the XML Schema definition language (XSD) of the specified <xref href="System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaSet"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaSet"></xref>.
A `string` value that indicates the XSD of the specified <xref href="System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaSet"></xref>.
Performs a logical comparison of the two <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> operands to determine whether the first is greater than the second.
A <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBoolean"></xref> that is <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBoolean.True"></xref> if the first instance is greater than the second instance.
Otherwise, <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBoolean.False"></xref>.

If either instance of <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> is null, the <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBoolean.Value"></xref> of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBoolean"></xref> will be <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBoolean.Null"></xref>.
Performs a logical comparison of the two <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> operands to determine whether the first is greater than or equal to the second.
A <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBoolean"></xref> that is <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBoolean.True"></xref> if the first instance is greater than or equal to the second instance.
Otherwise, <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBoolean.False"></xref>.

If either instance of <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> is null, the <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBoolean.Value"></xref> of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBoolean"></xref> will be <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBoolean.Null"></xref>.
Specifies that <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> comparisons should ignore case.
<xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString.IgnoreCase> functions as a constant for the <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString> class.
Specifies that the string comparison must ignore the Kana type.
Kana type refers to Japanese hiragana and katakana characters that represent phonetic sounds in the Japanese language.
Hiragana is used for native Japanese expressions and words, while katakana is used for words borrowed from other languages, such as "computer" or "Internet".
A phonetic sound can be expressed in both hiragana and katakana.
If this value is selected, the hiragana character for one sound is considered equal to the katakana character for the same sound.
<xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString.IgnoreKanaType> functions as a constant for the <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString> class.
Specifies that the string comparison must ignore non-space combining characters, such as diacritics.
The Unicode Standard defines combining characters as characters that are combined with base characters to produce a new character.
Non-space combining characters do not use character space by themselves when rendered.
For more information about non-space combining characters, see the Unicode Standard at http://www.unicode.org.
<xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString.IgnoreNonSpace> functions as a constant for the <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString> class.
Specifies that the string comparison must ignore the character width.

For example, Japanese katakana characters can be written as full-width or half-width and, if this value is selected, the katakana characters written as full-width are considered equal to the same characters written in half-width.
<xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString.IgnoreWidth> functions as a constant for the <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString> class.
Indicates whether this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> structure is null.
For more information, see [Handling Null Values](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/sql/handling-null-values.md).
`true` if <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString.Value"></xref> is <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString.Null"></xref>.
Otherwise, `false`.
Specifies the geographical locale and language for the <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> structure.
The locale id for the string stored in the <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString.Value"></xref> property.
Performs a logical comparison of the two <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> operands to determine whether the first is less than the second.

Otherwise, <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBoolean.False"></xref>.

If either instance of <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> is null, the <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBoolean.Value"></xref> of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBoolean"></xref> will be <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBoolean.Null"></xref>.
Performs a logical comparison of the two <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> operands to determine whether they are not equal.
A <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref>.

A <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBoolean"></xref> that is <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBoolean.True"></xref> if the two instances are not equal or <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBoolean.False"></xref> if the two instances are equal.

If either instance of <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> is null, the <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBoolean.Value"></xref> of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBoolean"></xref> will be <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBoolean.Null"></xref>.
Represents a <xref href="System.DBNull"></xref> that can be assigned to this instance of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> structure.
`Null` functions as a constant for the <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString> structure.
For more information, see [Handling Null Values](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/sql/handling-null-values.md).

A combination of one or more of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlCompareOptions"></xref> enumeration values that represent the way in which this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> should be compared to other <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> structures.

`true` if the <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString.Value"></xref> is non-zero; `false` if zero; otherwise Null.
Converts this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> structure to <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlByte"></xref>.
A new `SqlByte` structure whose <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlByte.Value"></xref> equals the number represented by this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> structure.
Converts this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> structure to <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlDateTime"></xref>.
A new `SqlDateTime` structure that contains the date value represented by this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref>.
Converts this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> structure to <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlDecimal"></xref>.
A new <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlDecimal"></xref> that contains the value of this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref>.
Converts this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> structure to <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlDouble"></xref>.
A new <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlDouble"></xref> that is equal to the numeric value of this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref>.
Converts this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> structure to <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlGuid"></xref>.

A new <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlGuid"></xref> structure whose <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlGuid.Value"></xref> is the `Guid` represented by this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> structure.
Converts this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> structure to <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlInt16"></xref>.
A new <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlInt16"></xref> that is equal to the numeric value of this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref>.
Converts this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> structure to <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlInt32"></xref>.
A new <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlInt32"></xref> that is equal to the numeric value of this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref>.
Converts this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> structure to <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlInt64"></xref>.
A new <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlInt64"></xref> that is equal to the numeric value of this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref>.
Converts this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> structure to <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlMoney"></xref>.
A new <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlMoney"></xref> that is equal to the numeric value of this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref>.
Converts this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> structure to <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlSingle"></xref>.
A new <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlSingle"></xref> that is equal to the numeric value of this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref>..
Converts a <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> object to a <xref href="System.String"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> with the same value as this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> structure.
Gets the string that is stored in this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> structure.
This property is read-only.
The string that is stored.
The value of the string is <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString.Null"></xref>.
This member supports the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
An `XmlSchema`.
